Georgia has the one of the highest rates of maternal mortality in the United States and over 20% of women in Georgia receive delayed prenatal care (or none at all) are women of color. Early access to prenatal care can save the lives of mothers and children. (1/3)

Join me on Sat., August 10th at our Annual Health Fair at Mundy’s Mill HS in Jonesboro, GA from 9am-2pm. FREE health care services will be available, including breast cancer screenings, glucose monitoring for diabetes, vision, dental, hearing, and mental health screenings. (2/2)

Too many of our loved ones, friends, and neighbors struggle to find and afford quality health care services. Without consistent access to preventative health screenings, many receive a diagnosis for deadly medical conditions too late. Early detection can save lives. (1/2)

Excited to have Dr. Rogsbert Phillips and @sbc1989 provide free breast cancer screenings at our #15thAnnualHealthFair this Saturday, 8/10 at Mundy’s Mill HS. Thanks @TMCV103 for helping us get the word out to your listeners this morning. pic.twitter.com/pprMGULviw

Honored to have @MSMPres join me on @atlandco to talk about my 15th Annual Health Fair & raise awareness for GA's maternal mortality crisis. @msmedu will provide free blood pressure screenings, glucose testing & primary care services at our Health Fair this Saturday, 8/10. pic.twitter.com/WHoXC3YgRE
Health care providers will be available to offer FREE screenings for uterine fibroids, breast cancer, diabetes, as well as a variety of other services. (2/2)

Over 11 million women in the U.S. have been impacted by uterine fibroids, and many have yet to receive a diagnosis. Early detection can save lives. Join me on Saturday, August 10th at our Annual Health Fair at Mundy’s Mill High School in Jonesboro, GA from 9:00am-2:00pm. (1/2)

Join me on Saturday, August 10th at our Annual Health Fair at Mundy’s Mill High School in Jonesboro, GA from 9:00am-2:00pm. FREE health care services will be available, including vision, dental, and hearing care, as well as mental health screenings. (2/2)

Our veterans often face significant challenges and barriers when seeking comprehensive health care services. Over 50,000 veterans live and work in Georgia’s 13th District and it is critical that they receive high-quality health care they deserve. (1/2)
